question: Outline the key study conducted to investigate context-dependent forgetting (6 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least six of the following points - Godden and Baddeley investigated the effects of contextual cues on recall, their sample was made up of 18 participants who were divided into four conditions, the groups consisted of learning and recalling words on land, learning and recalling words underwater, learning words on land and recalling underwater, and learning words underwater and recalling on land, the experiment used a repeated measures design, the study lasted four days, participants were presented with 38 words they heard twice and has to write all the words they could remember after, they concluded learning and recalling words in the same environment was much better, Godden and Baddeley concluded that environmental cues improve memory recall

question: Cognitive interviews have been developed to improve witness recall. Identify and explain two techniques used in the cognitive interview (6 marks):
answer: The answer should refer to at least six of the following points - the four techniques used are context reinstatement, recall from changed perspective, recall in reverse order and report everything, context reinstatement attempts to mentally recreate the situation including details of the environment, recall from changed perspective attempts to mentally recreate the situation from different points of view, recall in reverse order asks the witness to recall the scene in a different chronological order, and report everything encourages the eyewitness to recall all details of the event
